q: Long way to run for phone-hacking story Q&A: Tory search is under way for a new director of communications at No 10 after Andy Coulson resigned. ''We need to completely rethink the minivan,'' CEO Sergio Marchionne said Tuesday at the Canadian plant where Chrysler's minivans are made. We need to retain all its functionality but make it much more versatile. Sergio Marchionne said that could mean new products that can still carry a lot of people but won't look like traditional minivans. A team within the company is also studying whether to continue both the Town and Country

government, with no new products for much of the past two years. Only now is that situation starting to change, and Chrysler even has added back 5,000 workers to develop and build new vehicles. It can safely be said that what Chrysler delivered last year, on both the product and financial fronts, surpassed many expectations, Sergio Marchionne said Monday in a statement. The fact that Sergio Marchionne firmly defended the decision to pay hourly and salaried workers ''performance awards'' for the 2010 results indicates his confidence that the operating improvements will outpace the debt payments eventually.
